title: Morellonomicon: Our Lord and Savior
body:
{{item:3165}}* A reading from the book of the prophet Morello *{{item:3165}} 

And in the last day, for Riot said unto them: The Grasp of Death's fire shall be no more! In the wake of its demise, the people of magic cried: how shalt we itemize for both CDR and AP? 
Then answered them the  shop keeper; I bestow unto thee the one and only option for your woes - the gospel of the prophet himself - The Morellonomicon. And the people believed. Henceforth all men must devote themselves to one item, and one item only, if they desire both AP and CDR.

Morello 1:14

Also:  Does anyone else think it's incredibly redundant to have two 20% CDR AP/Manaregen items?  Why not remake Grail into a Tank item ({{item:3028}}+{{item:3024}}+{{item:3067}}) and then replace Blasting Wand with Codex in Abyssal Scepter's build, give the completed item 20% CDR, and let that be the MR/AP/CDR item for Mages?

Want CDR, AP, and mana regen?  Get Morello's.

Want CDR, mana regen, and defense?  Get Grail.

Want CDR, AP, and magic resist?  Get Abyssal.

If items do the same thing then people are just going to pick the best one.

Some mages rely on Chalice's superior pre-nerf mana regen to survive...Some champions had to watch their mana even when they had Chalice pre-4.21


Turning it into a Tank item isn't going to solve anything for them.

Well they're going to have to do SOMETHING to chalice to make it more appealing, because as it stands right now, pretty much everyone agrees that it never offers a better option than morello now that the mana regen is basically equal between the two, even after the grail buff. The problem is that the grail now functions based on maximum mana, **which means you need to build some mana before it will outperform the morellonomicon,** which defeats the purpose of the chalice as an early-game mana resolution. Now if you build it early, it's useless, and by the time you get to late game you don't need half the stats it gives you anymore. And lots of AP champs favor damage over mana anyway, so they don't build tear/RoA to build their mana pool to any significant amount; they just want the mana regen, and that's where {{item:3165}} outshines.
Yes this.  It already hurts enough to devote one item to mana(especially if your enemy doesn't have to), needing two is just harsh.
Is grail better than anything at... anything anymore?

Quite frankly, he' just inferior after nerfs after nerfs after indirect nerfs after indirect nerfs.


There was the first set of pre-emptive nerfs when Riot stupidly thought he'd be OP just because the meta started seeing dual AP long LONG ago.

After that, it's been nothing but one ufcking indirect nerf after another.


**MR rune nerfs** = &U@%'s Galio harder than anyone else
**MR itemization nerfs** = same as above
**The rework to Penetration** = MASSIVE nerf to all tanks
**REMOVAL of several expensive MR items** = Galio gets focked
**Repeated nerfs to Athene's** = Galio's core item nerfed repeatedly, while all champions that uses it is considered nerfed for it, Galio is hit harder
**Riot constantly adding more and MORE ways for enemy to easily interrupt his R with each rework and new champion**
Recent mana itemization nerfs = yeah


In the end...Galio just received thousands of nerfs. Yeah, many of them hit other champions too. But one thing to remember here is that all those nerfs...hits Galio WAY harder than it his all other champions.

And that is all atop the unnecessary nerf he first directly received.


Not only is he a tank not named Mundo or Maokai, he's had way more indirect nerfs than any other champion in the game.
I just recently started playing Galio mid and support, he's pretty fun, especially since the buff to his ult making it unaffected by tenacity.

When rushing double {{item:3165}}  is becoming a common place build for many AP champions because {{item:3028}} was over nerfed, clearly the answer is to remove {{item:3128}}.

Riot's "kick 'em while they're down" strategy at its finest. {{champion:48}}

**Verily the tome spoke:**

*"Do not gaze into the abyss,* {{item:3001}}* for the abyss stares back. And when hunting monsters, do not stray far from center, less ye become one."*{{summoner:11}}

Chalice should be the mana-regeneration item of the game, while Morello should perhaps be thrown into a more utilitarian position so that the two items cease competing for real-estate in mage builds. Basically, Chalice should give a lot more regen then it does now, Athene's should preserve its passive however the CDR should perhaps be reduced so that Morello becomes the go-to item for Champions who rely heavily on spamming. Instead of filling the same niche, the items would instead become complimentary; voilà, you suddenly make both items relevant. 

On the flip-side, the offensive values of Morello vastly overshadow the utility of Athene's. I seriously hope that Riot doesn't follow their own mantra and nerf Morello into oblivion and rather look for solutions to make Athene's the prime mana-regen item over the double-Morello strategy.

I like the idea of shifting Morello toward being the CDR item.

I think it might be a good idea to raise Athene's to 80 AP, because nobody wants anything lower than that in their final build (except on Void Staff, cuz Void Staff). Also drop 10% of its CDR in order to buff the regen passive past Morello's.
Overall stat change, when comparing Morello's to Athene's:

* Same AP, at 80
* 20% CDR compared to 10%
* 100% regen compared to [appropriate regen passive buff to make it much more appealing for regen]
* 0 MR compared to 25
* Grievous Wounds passive compared to not having it

Probably makes Athene's too powerful in comparison, but it's a step on the way to making Morello's the offense item and Athene's the defense item without having Athene's be obsolete.

Or leave the AP the same as it is currently, nerf Morello's mana regen, buff Athene's regen passive, and nerf Athene's CDR by 10%. With the right regen numbers, that could make Morello's the item for aggressively forcing your opponent out of lane, but at the cost of having low regen, while Athene's could be the lane-sustain item at the cost of less damage and slower spell rotations.
FAITH IN THE MORELLO!{{summoner:17}}

While you may be correct, the mana-regen difference is so small that most casters might be better off taking the offensive utility of Morello over Chalice. Being able to stop healing is only increasingly more efficient as more characters are being pumped out with means to restore lost HP (Zac, Aatrox, Rek'Sai). Having the same base regen as Morello as well as its 2% passive might actually make Chalice a lot more attractive for mana-hungry champions, while not overshadowing Morello's usefulness.
Not to mention that it's the only item that can stop Health Regen for enemy team, so it's mandatory for AP to get it in many set ups.

> Is grail better than anything at... anything anymore?

Grail is better than Infinity Edge for mana regen.  That's *something*.

When every mid is buying this, I feel like they took too many mage options away.

Also nerfing everything else to the point it has gotten without adding viable options is hurting things.  Now every champ that heals is somewhat less useful because if there's an AP mid, he's probably buying this.
